issues.summary: Fix URL Parameter Issue Causing Missing Booking Number and BOL in Shipment Details When Navigating from Orders Screen
issues.description:
*As a* shipper user navigating from the Order Overview screen,
*I want to* see the complete shipment details including Booking Number and Bill of Lading,
*So that* I can access critical freight documentation and make informed decisions about my shipments regardless of my navigation path.

h3. Details

The current implementation has a URL redirection issue when users navigate from the Orders screen to Shipment Overview. The navigation creates a malformed URL with {{[object Object]}} instead of the proper query parameter {{ids=<Load Number>}}, which prevents critical fields like Booking Number and Bill of Lading from being displayed.

*Current Broken Behavior:*

* Navigation from Order Overview → Shipment Overview generates URL: {{https://app.fourkites.com/beta/loads/626934750?[object Object]}}
* This malformed URL causes the frontend to fail in properly loading ocean service data
* Backend ocean service API has the correct booking number data but it's not mapped/displayed in the UI

*Expected Behavior:*

* Navigation should generate proper URL: {{https://app.fourkites.com/beta/loads/626934750?ids=ONEU9162082}}
* All shipment fields should display consistently regardless of navigation flow

*Root Cause:*

* Orders screen is incorrectly constructing the redirect URL query parameters
* Object is being passed where a string parameter is expected
* Frontend is not handling this gracefully and fails to load required data

*Business Impact:*

* *VVIP Customer Impact:* Blocking Tyson's end-user rollout (Implementation blocker)
* Loss of critical freight documentation visibility for users
* Inconsistent user experience creates confusion and support burden
* Affects both Booking Number and Bill of Lading fields (potentially other fields as well)

*Affected Customers:*

* Tyson Foods (VVIP - Implementation Blocker)
* Potentially all customers using Order-to-Shipment navigation flow

issues.summary: Refactor Carrier Events Tab to Filter Out historic data and show only latest carrier data
issues.description:
h2. Description

*As a* shipper user viewing ocean shipment tracking details,
*I want to* see only the most recent and relevant carrier events in the Carrier Events tab,
*So that* I can make accurate decisions based on up-to-date vessel schedules without confusion from duplicate or stale data.

h3. Details

The current implementation shows duplicate/historic carrier event estimates when the carrier's website includes. This results in a cluttered and potentially misleading Carrier Events view. This tab should always mimic the carrier website data.

*Root Cause:*

* Multiple updates for the truck leg create duplicate entries in Carrier Events view
* This is working as designed per current specification, but creates user confusion

*Proposed Solution:* Update the ERPA specification to:

# Identify and filter out historic/stale within the same port location
# Optionally maintain historical ETA data for explainability/debuggability in a separate view or backend storage

*Business Impact:*

* Improved user experience for shippers viewing ocean shipments
* More accurate and cleaner presentation of carrier event data
* Reduced customer support tickets related to confusing duplicate estimates
* Better alignment with carrier portal data presentation

*Affected Customer:* SC Johnson (example shipment: HLBU1603467)

issues.summary: Analysis of MM-13202 - Incorrect VA/VD events
issues.description:
Hi Team,

*Shipper:* Louis Dreyfus Company (LDC)
*Example Load:* ONEYTAOFL2320900

*Important Context*
Please note that LDC’s pilot phase with FourKites is nearing completion. As part of this, they will be closely reviewing service performance before making a final subscription decision. The issue outlined below has raised concerns on data reliability.Issue Summary
For the above shipment (and several others), *Vessel Departure (VD)* was marked via an *inferred event* _before_ the vessel was actually loaded.

* The *inferred VD* was marked on *12/02*
* The *actual ERPA update* with VD was received later on *12/04*, after vessel loading
* As a result, the customer sees VD occurring before the load event, which appears unrealistic and confusing

Additionally:

* The inferred *Vessel Arrival (VA)* and *Vessel Departure (VD)* show a gap of only ~2 hours at port
* LDC has questioned how a vessel can arrive and depart within such a short window, especially before loading is completed
* This behavior has been observed across multiple shipments

One consistent pattern across the affected shipments:

* All loads were *created on 12/23*
* However, the *actual sailing dates were on or before 12/02*

This suggests that the system may be inferring VA/VD events retrospectively for historical sailings, possibly due to *late load creation (LLC)*. We need confirmation on whether this is the expected behavior and if LLC is the root cause.Customer Impact

* Data appears unrealistic and inconsistent with actual vessel operations
* Loss of confidence in inferred events and milestone accuracy
* Risk to pilot success and final subscription decision

Ask / Next Steps

# Can you confirm whether *late load creation (LLC)* is causing these inferred VA/VD events to be backfilled incorrectly?
# Is there a way to *suppress or adjust inferred VA/VD* when the sailing has already occurred before load creation?
# What is the recommended *long-term fix* to prevent inferred VD being marked before actual vessel loading?
# Guidance on *customer-facing explanation* would be helpful before we respond to LDC.

Affected Shipments
*Evergreen*

* 159500040475
* 159500036762
* 159500048417
* 159500048719
* 159500048701
* 159500048182
* 159500040492
* 159500042028

*MSC*

* 177WATATQ1998RF

*ONE*

* ONEYTAOFL2320900
* ONEYTAOFL6937600
* ONEYTAOFL5237500
* ONEYTAOFL9184300
* ONEYTAOFL5250700
* ONEYTAOFK4728800
* ONEYTAOFL6262400
* TA5VYF673400
* TA5DKM940800

Please let us know your findings and recommended next steps so we can respond to the customer with clarity and confidence.

issues.summary: CLONE - Regarding shared External ID's across networks under 1 carrier account [P&G metrics affected]
issues.description:
Hi Ajay and RNK,

I know I've brought this up in the past but it seems like we're still
running into issues with processing EDI updates when an external ID is
shared across two different Shipper accounts. In the case of P&G, we have
two platform entities that share external IDs for various carriers:

* "Procter & Gamble" [perma: procter-gamble-north-america]
* "Procter & Gamble (Testing Environment)" [perma:
   procter-gamble-testing-environment]

!image-20250925-061548.png|width=873,height=110,alt="image-20250925-061548.png"!



!image-20250925-061602.png|width=873,height=116,alt="image-20250925-061602.png"!



In digging into P&G's timeliness metrics ahead of the governance call, I'm
finding that we are not processing EDI updates that are sent to us in a
timely manner and instead we're relying on RPA which for some reason is
processing updates very late:

!image-20250925-061631.png|width=1798,height=753,alt="image-20250925-061631.png"!



Hapag sent us an in-gate event on 9/12 but it appears the updates was not
processed because of the external ID issue. I'm not 100% sure if this
message below means that we didn't process the update due to the shared
external ID but I will raise a Support case to check.

Shipper: SC Johnson
Environment: Production
Feature Affected: User Experience
Load Mode: Multimodal
Load Example: NIDU5226856

Brief Description of the Issue: Taking NIDU5226856 as an example, vietnam loads are being mapped to KRAT times instead of ICT (both +07:00 as per IANA).

*Issue Description / Query:* The shipment incorrectly tracked the previous voyage due to the 45 day period. issues.summary: Extend Customer code / Ship to code display to Place of Receipt, Place of Delivery, and Rail Terminal stops
issues.description:
h2. *Description*

h3. User Story Statement

*As an* end customer using FK platform, *I want to* see Customer code, Customer name, and Ship to code on all stop types including Place of Receipt, Place of Delivery, Origin Rail Terminal, and Destination Rail Terminal, *So that* I can have complete visibility across the entire shipment journey regardless of stop type.

h3. Details

This story extends the functionality implemented in MM-11875 to include Ship to and Customer Code fields to the following additional stop types:

* *Place of Receipt*
* *Place of Delivery*
* *Origin Rail Terminal*
* *Destination Rail Terminal*

Currently, these fields are available on carrier-created TSP (Transhipment Port) stops as per MM-11875. This enhancement ensures consistency across all stop types for comprehensive shipment tracking and addresses the business need for complete visibility throughout the shipping journey.

h3. Business Impact & Critical Use Case

*RCS Logistics Platform Access Issue:*

RCS Logistics provides platform access to their end customers based on the "Customer or Ship To" code. Currently, since Place of Receipt, Place of Delivery, and Rail Terminal stops don't have these fields populated, *customers don't see these stops when they view shipments in the platform*. This creates significant visibility gaps:

* Customers cannot track shipments at Place of Receipt
* Customers lose visibility at Place of Delivery
* Rail terminal movements are completely hidden from customer view
* Customers must contact RCS support for information about these stop types
* Creates perception of incomplete tracking capability

*With this change:*

* Customers get *full visibility to all their stops* based on their Customer/Ship To access
* Platform access filtering works consistently across all stop types
* Reduced support inquiries as customers can self-serve
* Improved customer satisfaction and platform value perception
* Enhanced competitive positioning for RCS Logistics

h3. 

h3. Success Metrics

* 100% of Place of Receipt, Place of Delivery, and Rail Terminal stops display customer/ship to codes
* RCS Logistics customers report seeing all stop types that match their access credentials
* Reduction in customer service inquiries from RCS Logistics end customers about missing stop visibility
* Zero regression in existing stop type visibility

issues.summary: [VVIP] Inferred Event Timestamp deviating from the Carrier ATD from ERPA - Fastenal Company Purchasing
issues.description:
Hi Team, 

Shipper: Fastenal Company Purchasing
Carrier: Hyundai Merchant Marine
Environment: Production
Feature Affected: Tracking
Load Mode: Ocean
Load Example: 14255722

Brief Description of the Issue: 

The "Stops onLY" Section is displaying an incorrect "Vessel Departure" date as FourKites Departure
(Nov 13, 2025) which predates the Gate-In event (Dec 30 2025, 03:17 AM CST). This is occurring because an "Inferred Event" is taking precedence over a verified "ERPA Carrier Update" (Jan 03, 2026).


!Screenshot 2026-01-14 at 3.49.07 AM.png|width=686,alt="Screenshot 2026-01-14 at 3.49.07 AM.png"!




!Screenshot 2026-01-14 at 3.49.56 AM.png|width=686,alt="Screenshot 2026-01-14 at 3.49.56 AM.png"!

Correct Carrier Event (ERPA):

Status: Vessel Departure
Received At: 01/03/2026 09:42 CST
Occurred At: 01/03/2026 03:10 CST
Source: ERPA
Observation: This is the accurate event and is visible in the timeline.

Erroneous Inferred Event:

Status: Inferred Vessel Departure
Calculated At: 01/02/2026 21:33 CST
Occurred Timestamp (Bug): 11/13/2025 19:20 CST
Observation: The inferred event generated a timestamp 2 months in the past. This timestamp predates the Gate-In milestone.

Expected Behavior: 

The Inferred Event should display timelines which should be aligning with the carrier update

Actual Behavior: 

The "Stops" section and "All Milestones" section display Nov 13, 2025, 07:20 PM CST as the POL departure time through Inferred Event.

issues.summary: [VVIP] Carrier Data Issues
issues.description:
*Shipper:* Smithfield Foods 

*Carrier:* Zim 

*3PL:* N/A

*Impacted Feature:* Tracking 

*Environment:* Production 

*Load Numbers:* 4304230938

*Issue Description / Query:* There is incorrect carrier data on their website. The load started from an inland pickup and went to a rail terminal before going on a vessel. There is an 11/27 rail in gate, however then there is a 12/3 loaded on vessel event but then a VD event for 11/11. It doesn’t look like we ingested the incorrect data but when carrier info isn’t correct how to we handle these scenarios? As the customer wants to know why this load is in ‘At Port of Loading’ status when it should be in ‘Departed Port of Loading’ based on the locations we received from Spire following the loaded on vessel event on 12/3 that are near delivery - can we confirm why the geofence logic did not apply here? Is this not set up for Smithfield on the back end? 

*Steps to Reproduce:* N/A 

*Logs Link / Logs attached: (Logs should be downloaded and attached to the Jira ticket)*

[^log_data - 2026-01-13T111920.704 (1).csv]

*Log Query and Time frame: (Log Query used should be added to the Jira ticket)*

service.name = multimodal-carrier-updates-worker, body CONTAINS ZMOU8963039

*Super API Response: (This should be added wherever applicable)* N/A

*Initial RCA:(This should provide detailed investigation notes):* The load remains stuck in 'At Port of Loading' status despite vessel location data showing it near delivery because geofence-based Vessel Departure (VD) logic did not trigger following the 12/3 Loaded on Vessel event. While the carrier portal provided an implausible VD event dated 11/11 (before the 11/27 rail in-gate), this incorrect data was not ingested into our system. The root cause is that geofence-based auto-VD functionality appears to not be enabled for Smithfield, preventing the system from automatically updating the load status based on Spire location data that clearly indicates vessel departure from POL. This highlights a gap in handling scenarios where carrier milestone data is unreliable and automated fallback mechanisms need to compensate.

*Screenshots:*

!image-20260113-204848.png|width=669,alt="image-20260113-204848.png"!

*Expected Result:* For the geofence to mark the vessel as arrived at POD

*Actual Result:* Load is in ‘at Port of Loading’ status despite locations from spire near delivery

issues.summary: Ocean Callback: stopLocode Not Populated for Delivery Stop – UN/LOCODE Sent in stopReferenceId
issues.description:
Hi Team,


h3. *Customer*

Louis Dreyfus Company (LDC)

----

h3. *Load Details*

* *Load ID:* CMCU4580319
* *Mode:* Ocean
* *Callback Type:* FourKites Standard Callback
* *Event Type:* Unloading at Delivery

----

h3. *Issue Description*

For the above load, the Ocean *Unloading (Delivery)* event callback contains a valid UN/LOCODE (*HNCHO*), however it is populated under the {{stopReferenceId}} field. The expected {{stopLocode}} field is *not populated* in the callback payload.

LDC requires the {{stopLocode}} field to ingest and process carrier events. When this field is not populated, the event cannot be consumed by their downstream system, resulting in the carrier event being missed, even though the UN/LOCODE is present elsewhere in the payload.

Both the *raw carrier event payload* and the *transformed callback payload* were reviewed and confirm that:

* UN/LOCODE *HNCHO* is present in {{stopReferenceId}}
* {{stopLocode}} is not populated for the delivery stop

----

h3. *Expected Behavior*

If a UN/LOCODE is available for a pickup or delivery stop, it should be populated in the {{stopLocode}} field in the Ocean event callback.

----

h3. *Actual Behavior*

* {{stopLocode}} = null
* UN/LOCODE populated in {{stopReferenceId}} instead

----

h3. *Impact*

* LDC is unable to ingest the Ocean delivery event
* Carrier events may be missed when {{stopLocode}} is not populated
* Impacts customer trust and data completeness, especially for Ocean milestones

----

h3. *Questions for Engineering*

# Is {{stopLocode}} *expected to be populated for pickup and delivery stops* in Ocean standard callbacks?
# Why is the UN/LOCODE being populated under {{stopReferenceId}} instead of the {{stopLocode}} field?
# Is this behavior *by design*, or a *gap/bug in the event transformation logic*?
# Can the transformation be updated to *consistently populate* {{stopLocode}} when a UN/LOCODE is available for pickup/delivery stops?

----

h3. *Attachments*

* Raw event payload
* Transformed callback payload



Transformed payload:

{{"{\"BillOfLading\":\"CWPS25189752\",\"BookingNumber\":\"CAT40079325\",\"ContainerNumber\":\"CMCU4580319\",\"ContainerType\":\"LPG1\",\"FourKitesDataSource\":\"Carrier\",\"FourKitesLoadId\":616204092,\"LoadNumber\":\"CMCU4580319\",\"Message\":\"Completed unloading at delivery location. Shipment was delivered to the consignee or receiver.\",\"MessageType\":\"OCEAN_UPDATE\",\"ProNumber\":null,\"ReferenceNumbers\":[\"CAT40079325\",\"S12965.A01\"],\"Scac\":\"CPRC\",\"Shipper\":\"louis-dreyfus-company\",\"Status\":\"Unloaded at Delivery\",\"StatusCode\":\"D\",\"StopName\":\"Choloma,HN\",\"StopReferenceId\":\"HNCHO\",\"StopType\":\"delivery\",\"Tags\":[],\"TerminalName\":null,\"Timestamp\":\"2026-01-10T07:37:00-06:00\",\"Timezone\":\"America/Tegucigalpa\",\"TimezoneOffset\":-21600,\"VesselName\":null,\"VoyageNumber\":null}"}}

issues.summary: Stuck at POD Column Sync for Unified Export
issues.description:
h2. *Summary/Title*

Fix Stuck at POD Exception Data Sync to Unified Export Table for Scheduled Reports

h2. *User Story Statement*

*As a* logistics operations manager using scheduled custom reports,
*I want to* see accurate "Stuck at POD" exception data in my exported reports,
*So that* I can effectively monitor and manage containers that have been at the Port of Discharge for extended periods.

h2. *Description*

Customer (Tama) has reported that when they create a scheduled custom report with "Stuck at POD" column selected, the exported report shows this column as blank despite the filter being configured correctly in the UI.

h3. Root Cause Analysis:

The issue occurs during the sync process from the STUCK_AT_POD records to the Unified Export table. Certain mandatory vessel-related fields (vessel name, vessel IMO, vessel MMSI) are missing in the STUCK_AT_POD data for affected loads, which prevents successful synchronization.

*Why mandatory fields are missing:*

* When Vessel Arrival (VA) updates for POD are received from carriers, vessels are correctly unassigned from loads
* However, when VA for POD is triggered via geofence, vessels are NOT unassigned from loads
* Without subsequent load non-status transition events, the vessel data remains incomplete in the sync message
* This causes the Stuck at POD data to fail syncing to the Unified Export table

h3. Current vs. Expected Behavior:

*Current Behavior:*

* Stuck at POD exceptions are calculated only for "At Port of Discharge" status in Unified Export
* When VA is triggered by geofence, vessel data is not properly maintained
* Scheduled exports show blank Stuck at POD column for affected loads

*Expected Behavior:*

* Stuck at POD exceptions should be calculated and synced for both "At Port of Discharge" AND "Discharged" statuses
* Vessel data should be properly maintained regardless of how VA is triggered (carrier update or geofence)
* Scheduled exports should consistently display Stuck at POD data showing number of days stuck

h2. *Acceptance Criteria*

# *Stuck at POD Exception Status Coverage*
#* *Given* a load is at Port of Discharge or has been Discharged
#* *When* the load has been at POD for 3 days or more
#* *And* a scheduled custom export is generated with "Stuck at POD" selected
#* *Then* the export should contain the number of days the load has been stuck at POD
# *Vessel Data Integrity for Geofence-Triggered Events*
#* *Given* a Vessel Arrival (VA) event is triggered via geofence at POD
#* *When* the load status transitions occur
#* *And* the Stuck at POD exception is calculated
#* *Then* all mandatory vessel fields (vessel name, IMO, MMSI) should be properly populated in the sync message
# *Unified Export Sync Validation*
#* *Given* a load has Stuck at POD exception data
#* *When* the data is synced to the Unified Export table
#* *And* all mandatory fields are present
#* *Then* the sync should complete successfully and data should be visible in scheduled exports
# *Consistency Across All Export Mechanisms*
#* *Given* Stuck at POD exception conditions are met
#* *When* data is displayed in UI, scheduled exports, callbacks, or notifications
#* *Then* all mechanisms should show consistent calculation and values
# *Historical Data Validation*
#* *Given* existing loads with Stuck at POD conditions that previously failed to sync
#* *When* the fix is deployed
#* *Then* a backfill or refresh mechanism should be available to correct historical data

issues.summary: Manual Update of POL Departure Dates (2005 -> 2025) Required for Delivered Loads - PepsiCo Import-Export
issues.description:
Hi Team, 

Shipper: PepsiCo Import-Export
Carrier: KUEHNE & NAGEL INC
Environment: Production
Feature Affected: Tracking
Load Mode: Ocean
Load Example: FTAU2153400, CMAU2403334

Brief Description of the Issue: 

The shipper “PepsiCo Import-Export” is reporting skewed data in their Transit Time Analytics. Two specific Ocean loads have a POL Vessel Departure timestamp showing the year 2005 instead of 2025.

The carrier (Kuehne + Nagel) originally transmitted the "Vessel Departure" event via EDI with the incorrect year (2005). While the carrier has since fixed their feed, they cannot re-transmit updates for these specific loads because they are already marked as "Delivered/Completed" in the FourKites platform, and our logic prevents updates to finalized loads.

The customer uses the Analytics Dashboard for KPI calculations. The incorrect year (2005) results in a calculated transit time of ~20 years, creating massive outliers that distort their averages. The customer has explicitly stated they cannot use the dashboard until this is resolved.

Please perform a manual backend update to correct the POL Vessel Departure for the affected loads and ensure this change is propagated to the Analytics/Insights database.

[^Wrong POL Departure Time (1).csv] 

Expected Behavior: 

The system data should reflect the operational reality of the shipment, regardless of the initial carrier error. The specific loads (FTAU2153400 & CMAU2403334) should reflect accurate transit times, restoring the integrity of the customer's aggregate KPI reporting.

Actual Behavior: 

The system is currently retaining the incorrect "2005" timestamp received from the carrier's initial erroneous transmission.

issues.summary: ODL Delivery ETA issue
issues.description:
h2. Problem Summary

ODL customer is not receiving final delivery location ETAs from C.H. Robinson EDI 315 updates. Despite the carrier sending ETA updates (AG events) with R4 segments containing delivery timestamps and UN/LOCODE information, the platform is failing to process and apply these ETAs to the final delivery stop.

----

h2. Business Impact

* *Customer Concern:* ODL relies on accurate delivery ETAs to update their TMS systems
* *Weekly follow-ups:* This is the customer's main concern in recurring meetings
* *Trust Issue:* Customer is hesitant to use FourKites ETAs due to discrepancies between platform ETAs and carrier-provided ETAs
* *Example Discrepancy:* Platform showing ETA of 16th vs. carrier indicating 18th-20th

----

h2. Technical Details

h3. Root Cause Analysis Required

*Issue 1: Address Matching Failure*

* Carrier sends AG updates with UN/LOCODE {{USZLD}} (Zealand) for final delivery location
* Platform attempts to match against Global Address Manager but fails
* Error: "Event alert address not found for the EPA ones"
* UN/LOCODE {{USZLD}} not found in either:
** ODL's Address Manager
** Global Address Manager

*Issue 2: R4 Segment Not Processed*

* EDI 315 files contain R4 segments with:
** UN/LOCODEs for delivery locations
** DTM timestamps for ETAs
* R4 segment data is completely ignored in ETA calculation
* This occurs even when other milestones are successfully processed

*Issue 3: Place of Delivery (PoDL) Stop Issues*

* Backend shows Place of Delivery stop (e.g., {{USBRO}} - Brownsville, Texas) created between POD and final delivery
* PoDL stop is NOT visible in UI (possibly hidden by company settings)
* Even when PoDL stop exists with matching UN/LOCODE in Global Address:
** Stop type shows as "Unknown"
** ETA from R4 segment not applied to PoDL
** Delivery stop ETA not calculated based on PoDL ETA

*Issue 4: Inconsistent Processing*

* Some loads receive and display carrier ETA successfully
* Others with similar structure fail to process
* Need to identify difference between working and failing cases

----

h2. Examples Provided

h3. Failing Case 1

* *Load:* [Reference numbers differ in transcript]
* *Carrier ETA:* 18th-20th (per carrier communication)
* *Platform ETA:* 16th
* *Issue:* Final delivery ETA not updating

h3. Failing Case 2

* *Final Delivery Location:* USZLD (Zealand)
* *PoDL Location:* USBRO (Brownsville, Texas)
* *Status:* USBRO exists in Global Address but ETA not applied

h3. Working Case (Exception)

* One example where carrier ETA was successfully processed and displayed
* Need to identify why this case worked differently

----

h2. Current Operational Context

* *Tracking Method:* Pure EDI 315 from C.H. Robinson (no RPA involved)
* *Carrier Behavior:* C.H. Robinson only considers load-level ETA, not stop-level ETAs
* *Stop Structure:* Loads contain intermediate PoDL stops between POD and final delivery
* *Carrier Issue (Separate):* C.H. Robinson also unable to send POL ETA updates (operational challenge on their side)

----

h2. Investigation Requirements

h3. Primary Questions to Answer

# *Address Matching Logic:*
#* Why does R4 segment check Global Address Manager instead of customer's Address Manager?
#* Is this because PoDL feature is enabled?
#* Can we force R4 segment to check Address Manager first?
# *PoDL Stop Processing:*
#* Why are PoDL stops hidden in UI?
#* What controls PoDL visibility (company settings)?
#* Why does stop type show as "Unknown" even when UN/LOCODE matches?
#* What conditions prevent ETA application to existing PoDL stops?
# *Delivery Stop Matching:*
#* What are the exact conditions for creating/not creating PoDL stops?
#* Currently doesn't create if same as POL or POD - does this check include delivery stop?
#* Why isn't delivery stop ETA calculated from PoDL ETA when PoDL exists?
# *Working vs. Failing Cases:*
#* Identify differences between the one working case and multiple failing cases
#* Could be timing-related (older vs. newer)?
#* Could be data quality differences?

----

h2. Proposed Investigation Steps

# *Debug EDI Processing Flow:*
#* Trace complete path of EDI 315 AG update processing
#* Identify exact point where address matching fails
#* Document decision logic for Global Address vs. Address Manager lookup
# *Analyze R4 Segment Handling:*
#* Verify R4 segment parsing is working correctly
#* Identify why R4 ETA data is not applied to any stop
#* Check if R4 processing is dependent on address matching success
# *Review PoDL Configuration:*
#* Check ODL company settings for PoDL flags
#* Identify UI visibility controls for PoDL stops
#* Verify backend stop creation logic and type assignment
# *Compare Working vs. Failing Cases:*
#* Pull detailed logs for both scenarios
#* Identify configuration or data differences
#* Document conditions that allow successful processing

----

h2. Potential Solutions to Evaluate

h3. Option 1: Address Manager Population

* Add common C.H. Robinson UN/LOCODEs to ODL's Address Manager
* Map to corresponding delivery locations
* *Question:* Will this force R4 segment to check Address Manager?
* *Concern:* May not solve root cause if logic still checks Global Address first

h3. Option 2: Disable PoDL Feature (Similar to NextTracker)

* NextTracker case: Disabled rail stops, allowed direct ETA application to delivery
* Used city/country matching from RPA to associate with final delivery
* *Question:* Will disabling PoDL for ODL force R4 segment ETAs to apply to delivery stops?
* *Concern:* EDI 315 != RPA; different matching logic may be needed

h3. Option 3: Fix R4 Segment Processing

* Modify logic to always process R4 segment data regardless of address matching
* Apply ETAs to appropriate stops based on stop sequence
* Update both PoDL and delivery stop ETAs when R4 data available

h3. Option 4: Enhanced Address Matching

* Implement fallback matching logic:
*# First check customer Address Manager
*# Then check Global Address Manager
*# Use fuzzy matching on city/state/country if UN/LOCODE fails
* Ensure stop type correctly assigned when match found

----

h2. Success Criteria

# ✅ R4 segment ETA data from EDI 315 successfully processed
# ✅ Final delivery location receives carrier ETA updates
# ✅ Platform ETA matches carrier-communicated ETA (within reasonable tolerance)
# ✅ ETAs sync correctly to DWH for reporting
# ✅ Customer can reliably use FourKites ETAs in their TMS systems

----

h2. Timeline & Priority

* *Customer Expectation:* Top priority resolution
* *Weekly Customer Meetings:* Issue discussed in recurring calls with ODL + C.H. Robinson
* *Next Customer Meeting:* TBD (weekly cadence)
* *Target Resolution:* ASAP to maintain customer confidence

----

h2. Additional Context

h3. Related Systems Impact

* TMS integration depends on accurate ETAs
* DWH syncing may be affected by incomplete stop state transitions
* Reporting metrics (e.g., VD completeness) may be understated

h3. Similar Historical Case

* *NextTracker Issue:* Similar ETA application problem resolved by:
** Disabling rail/PoDL stops
** Using city/country matching from RPA
** Backend changes to Get Shipments API
** UI display updates
* *Key Difference:* NextTracker used RPA; ODL uses EDI 315

Issue Description / Query: From Amanda:

Are you able to see why there are no Status/Milestone Updates for truck moves for Tyson ocean loads? (Screenshots attached)

Sometime it’s just “Auto Pick Up” : RICFQB540900, RICFQC960900, RICFQB550300

Sometimes they are just blank: NAM8219615, VSSL001437155

RICFPE371600 / ONEU9033969: This one is Rail, and we see a lot of tracking info on ONEY site, none of them reflected on FourKites

Steps to Reproduce: Checked individual carrier websites to confirm if loads were tracking. For ONEU9033969, I noticed the Pickup location was showing in Lexington, KY but the carrier's website has Lexington, NE as the pickup location. Is this the cause of this load not tracking via rail before the container reached the POL?

For the other load examples, I can see milestones within multimodal-carrier-updates-worker, but I need more insight into the expected behavior of loads before the container reaches the POL.

I don't see any updates from the carriers where either the loads were marked as picked up by Auto Pickup or there is no Auto Pickup milestone.

Actual Result:  Breadcrumbs aren't visible from pickup locaiton to POL for these loads. More clarity is needed on expected behavior.

issues.summary: Decouple ds_kitebot_service and transition Disruption services to ISBU ownership
issues.description:
Description:

Currently, the ds_kitebot_service exposes 7 endpoints.

Out of these, 5 endpoints are directly used by the Disruption Dashboard. These five were jointly built by the Disruption and ISBU teams, were treated as high-priority, and are currently maintained by ISBU. The ISBU team is also already familiar with this codebase.

The remaining 2 endpoints (highlighted in green) are used by agent workflows and are not part of the Disruption Dashboard path.

Given this split, an initial lift-and-shift to Azure is a low-risk first step. If needed, we can migrate only the 5 Disruption-related endpoints and re-package them as a standalone service (e.g., disruption-service). This will allow us to progressively decouple Disruption from agent-specific dependencies, which we expect will be necessary long-term.

Decision (from meeting on 12-01-2026):

We agreed to decouple the Disruption functionality from ds_kitebot_service and have ISBU own the Disruption services across both AWS and Azure.

Ask:

Create and prioritize this work in Q1 to:

Split Disruption endpoints from agent-specific endpoints

Establish ISBU ownership for Disruption services

Enable independent deployment and scaling in AWS and Azure

issues.summary: Schreiber Foods - Shipment showing under “No ETA” filter despite having Planned & Actual Arrival dates
issues.description:
The customer(Schreiber Foods) reported an issue where a shipment appears under the “No ETA” filter even though ETA-related data is available.

They shared an example shipment on this lane for reference and provided a screenshot. Based on the shipment details:

* The shipment shows Planned Arrival: Jan 04, 2026
* Actual Arrival: Jan 02, 2026
* Shipment status is Discharged
* Transit and event data (including unloading from vessel) are present

Despite this, the shipment is still being flagged under the No ETA filter, which is causing confusion for the customer and impacting their ability to rely on ETA-based views and workflows.

*Ask*:
Please investigate why this shipment is being categorized under the No ETA filter when ETA information (planned and actual) exists, and confirm the defect.

*Reference*:
Screenshot attached by customer for the specific shipment example.

issues.summary: Loads Still Tracking
issues.description:
Shipper: Arizona Tile

Carrier: Mediterranean Shipping Company (MSC)

3PL:

Impacted Feature: International Solutions

Environment: Production

Load Numbers: MSDU2764991, MSNU1618570, TGBU3052317

Issue Description / Query: Customer concerned about loads still populating ETA's when each load has been marked as delivered within carrier's website.

Steps to Reproduce: Checked the bill of lading number for each load on the carrier's website. Could see each BOL had been marked as delivered. I then checked the JT subscription for each load and although MSDU2764991 and TGBU3052317 started out with REFERENCE_NOT_FOUND messages, they would later have successful crawl attempts.

I then checked the location details for each load and can see we're still processing location updates for the assigned vessels and the POL and POD geofences were both missed on each load.

Logs Link / Logs attached: [^log_data - 2026-01-08T160719.039.csv] [^log_data - 2026-01-08T161838.069.csv] [^log_data - 2026-01-08T161802.872.csv] [^log_data - 2026-01-08T161654.673.csv] [^log_data - 2026-01-08T161333.588.csv] [^log_data - 2026-01-08T161256.852.csv] [^log_data - 2026-01-08T160837.423.csv] 

Log Query and Time frame: multimodal-carrier-updates-worker and global-worker for the last 3 days. With global-worker, I filtered to use the message_type of POST_LOCATION_UPDATE

Super API Response: 

Initial RCA:This doesn’t appear to be expected behavior. The loads are delivered within the carrier’s website, but we’re still tracking the containers. The containers weren’t detected within the POL or POD geofences either.

issues.summary: Klein Tools - Exit Mode and Static ETA to Delivery Issues
issues.description:
Issue from Klein Tools 


* Klein Tools needs *accurate, trustworthy ETAs from the very beginning of the shipment (at departure)* so their purchasing team can make correct air freight vs. ocean decisions. Until early ETAs are reliable and the inconsistency issues are addressed, they will not renew the contract.
* *Open Items Are:*
** Different transit times for containers arriving the same day at the same port/route
*** CMAU9536072 --> Arrives at USLAX 1/19, departs 1/26, arrives at Delivery on 1/30
*** 1071391445 --> Arrives at USLAX 1/19, departs 1/26, arrives at Delivery on 1/26
*** CMAU7946376 --> Arrives as USLAX 1.19, departs 1/26, arrives at Delivery on 1/30

* Wide variation in days from port arrival to Dallas delivery
** Same scenario as above. Load CMAU9536072 has 4 day transit from POD to Delivery, Load 1071391445 has 1 day transit from POL to Delivery.

* Initial ETAs that are clearly unrealistic or wrong
** Load 1070269901 in previous discussion has since been normalized, but Klein Tools wants to know how we can rectify carrier incorrectness like this immediately

* Understanding that rail-specific updates are driven only when shipments hit US West Coast rail
** Want to know if we can work towards bringing the "rail" component into the ETA earlier, before departure from the POD and information is shared by RailInc (they want this to be built into the ETA immediately after departure from the POL). 

* Lack of confidence that “identical” scenarios are treated consistently
** Links to above scenarios, where certain loads have an ETA at the POD on the same day but have different ETAs to the Delivery

issues.summary: ATD Mismatch
issues.description:
Hi Team,

Shipper - Ford Img
Load - MRKU6684326

Issue - The pick ATD is marked as Nov 10th, but customer is stating the date as incorrect. When checking the milestone updates, we have not received any ATD event for pickup. Only Empty Equipment Dispatched has been received. In the logs, no trace for the ATD timestamp. Need to check from where the ATD has been retrieved and updated to the stop. Even the ATD logic of 48 hours is also not matching with the ATD timestamp.

THis is happening because of Substitution logic. [https://fourkites.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/CS1/pages/18180472857/Internal+Technical+FAQ+-+MM+Queries+February+25#VD-Not-Captured-for-Container|https://fourkites.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/CS1/pages/18180472857/Internal+Technical+FAQ+-+MM+Queries+February+25#VD-Not-Captured-for-Container|smart-link] 

But there isn't any clear documentation for this.

Expected Behavior - No trace of ATD timestamp from the logs

Actual Behavior - ATD has been updated incorrectly

issues.summary: [AZURE] Enable shipment-event-service and shipment-event-worker in Staging
issues.description:
h4. *Background*

The {{shipment-event-service}} and {{shipment-event-worker}} are currently not available in the AZURE *Staging* environment. To support end-to-end testing and validation for multimodal workflows, these services need to be deployed and fully accessible in the staging AKS cluster.

----

h4. *Scope of Work*

* Deploy *shipment-event-service* to *Staging AKS*
* Deploy *shipment-event-worker* to *Staging AKS*
* Enable deployments using *Helm charts*
* Configure required *Ingress*, *DNS*, and *AKS networking*
* Ensure services are reachable and functional in staging

issues.summary: Complete End-to-End ETA Module Testing – Azure Staging & Production
issues.description:
h4. *End-to-End ETA Module Testing (Mandatory)*

* Validate *ETA generation from load creation to final stop completion*
* Verify *Dynamic ETA* behavior for:
** Load creation
** Stop updates
** ETA refresh triggers
* Validate complete *event flow*:
** Ocean/Tracking workers → ETA worker
** ETA worker → Data Science (DS)
* Confirm {{SYNC_LOAD_TO_ETA_SERVICE}} events are:
** Triggered correctly
** Consumed successfully
* Verify ETA updates are reflected correctly in downstream systems/UI

issues.summary: Mismatch Between Carrier Events Only & Hapag Lloyd Carrier Website Events (Ref: HLBU1603467)
issues.description:
Customer: SC Johnson

Reference: HLBU1603467

When we look at the carrier website screen and the carrier only events screen in Shipment Overview, the old historic data is being shown even though it is not logical and also it is old.

The Vessel “ACHELOOS” is used between Zeebrugge to Hamburg. It has departed from Zeebrugge and yet to arrive at Hamburg. The carrier events only screen is showing below events:

# Estimate Arrival at Hamburg with vessel “CMA CGM JACQUES JOSEPH” reported on {{2025-12-19}}
# Estimate Discharge at Hamburg with vessel “ACHELOOS” reported on {{2026-01-02}}

I guess the problem is that initially carrier has given estimated arrival with one vessel and later gave only estimated discharge with new vessel without any estimated arrival. Since both events are unique in nature, we are still showing both events which is not logical and the data is also stale. Please confirm on the same.

If the above is true, then we might need to think on how not to show this stale or illogical data with some intelligent filtering.

Attached screenshots from carrier and UI.

cc:  [~accountid:5cb3835dd6bf930e88263df6] [~accountid:712020:cfb6932d-8355-42dd-b3ac-60d1dc366e3b]

issues.summary: Update DSV Ocean Parser to Handle Empty Containers Field in API Response
issues.description:
h2. Background

Related to [MM-13047|https://fourkites.atlassian.net/browse/MM-13047] - During investigation of booking CAN7410804, we discovered that DSV API returns responses with an empty {{containers}} field ({{"containers": []}}).

h2. Problem Statement

According to the DSV API specification, the {{containers}} field should not be blank. However, DSV is returning responses where this field is empty. Our current parser logic:

# Expects container numbers to be present under {{containers/containerNumber}}
# Ties events to each container number listed
# Skips parsing entirely when {{containers}} is empty, resulting in *no events being processed*

This causes loads to remain untracked even when DSV has shipment data available.

h2. Current Behavior

When DSV returns an empty {{containers}} array:

* Parser does not process any events
* Load shows error: {{"Empty CARRIER API response for DSV Ocean"}}
* No tracking data is applied to the load

h2. Expected Behavior

Parser should handle the edge case of empty {{containers}} field gracefully. Options to consider:

# *Apply events at shipment level* - If containers are empty, apply events to the shipment/booking without container-level granularity
# *Extract container from event data* - Some events contain container numbers in {{eventTypeValue}}; these could be extracted
# *Log and alert* - Log the anomaly for monitoring while still processing available data

h2. DSV API Spec Reference

* Spec Doc: [DSV Ocean API Spec|https://docs.google.com/document/d/1SJ4Eq9XIgKnVBwIISBLxhYrpbbLEDpoE9vu5bY_W6RQ/edit?tab=t.0]
* Key rules from spec:
** Query using House Bill Number / FF Booking Number / Container Number
** Pick container numbers from {{containers/containerNumber}}
** If multiple containers: events apply to all
** If container mentioned in event ({{eventTypeValue}}): tie to that specific container only

h2. Sample DSV Response (CAN7410804)

{code:json}{
    "shipmentId": "SCAN7410804",
    "status": "COMPLETED",
    "containers": [],  // <-- Empty array causing the issue
    ...
}{code}

h2.

issues.summary: Apply UI Fallback Logic for Stop Arrival Time in Ocean Export Reports
issues.description:
h1. User Story

h2. Description

*As a* supply chain operations manager reviewing ocean shipments in bulk via exports,  
*I want* the {{ARRIVED_AT_PORT_OF_DISCHARGE}} column to consistently populate with arrival timestamps using the same fallback logic as the UI,  
*So that* I can perform mass reviews and KPI calculations without manual validation of missing data.

h3. Problem Context

Currently, there is an inconsistency between the UI and Export behavior for POD arrival times:

* *UI Behavior*: When "Vessel Arrival" event is missing, the UI uses "Unloaded from Vessel" event timestamp as a fallback and displays it as ATA for POD
* *Export Behavior*: Export strictly looks for "Vessel Arrival" event only, leaving the {{ARRIVED_AT_PORT_OF_DISCHARGE}} column blank when this event is missing, even though "Unloaded from Vessel" data exists

This discrepancy creates operational challenges for customers who rely on exports for bulk reviews, as blank fields are incorrectly interpreted as shipments not having arrived yet.

h3. Customer Impact

*Customer*: SC Johnson (Dollarcity)  
*Salesforce Case*: [02672025|https://fourkites.lightning.force.com/lightning/r/Case/500Ps000016aArJIAU/view]  
*Related Query Ticket*: MM-13137

Customer feedback: _"Part of our team reviews arrival times in bulk using the exported reports, not directly in the platform. When this field is empty in the report, we interpret it as the shipment not having arrived yet, which leads to incorrect conclusions and additional manual validation. Since the platform already infers arrival time from the 'Unloaded from Vessel' event when the 'Vessel Arrival' event is missing, the report should apply the same fallback logic."_

----

h2. Acceptance Criteria

h3. 1. *Export Logic Mirrors UI Logic*

* *Given* a shipment has "Unloaded from Vessel" event but no "Vessel Arrival" event for POD
* *When* the shipment data is exported via ocean shipment reports
* *Then* the {{ARRIVED_AT_PORT_OF_DISCHARGE}} column should be populated with the "Unloaded from Vessel" event timestamp

h3. 2. *Consistent Behavior Across Export Types*

* *Given* the export fallback logic is implemented
* *When* exports are generated via scheduled reports, ad-hoc exports, or API endpoints
* *Then* all export types should apply the same fallback logic consistently

h3. 3. *No Impact on Existing Vessel Arrival Events*

* *Given* a shipment has an actual "Vessel Arrival" event for POD
* *When* the shipment data is exported
* *Then* the {{ARRIVED_AT_PORT_OF_DISCHARGE}} column should continue to use the "Vessel Arrival" timestamp (no change from current behavior)

h3. 4. *Backward Compatibility*

* *Given* the export logic change is deployed
* *When* existing customer exports are regenerated
* *Then* previously blank {{ARRIVED_AT_PORT_OF_DISCHARGE}} fields should now be populated with fallback timestamps where applicable

----

h2. Functional Testing Scenarios

* *Scenario 1*: Verify export populates POD arrival when only "Unloaded from Vessel" exists
** Test shipments: CO20251018, CO20251019 (from MM-13137)
** Verify {{ARRIVED_AT_PORT_OF_DISCHARGE}} matches UI display
* *Scenario 2*: Verify "Vessel Arrival" event takes precedence over "Unloaded from Vessel"
** Test with shipments that have both events
** Confirm "Vessel Arrival" timestamp is used
* *Scenario 3*: Verify exports remain blank when neither event exists
** Test with shipments missing both "Vessel Arrival" and "Unloaded from Vessel"
** Confirm field remains empty as expected

----

h2. Technical Implementation Notes

h3. Current Implementation Gap

* Export Service queries only for "Vessel Arrival" (VA) event code
* UI applies fallback logic: uses "Unloaded from Vessel" (UV) event when VA is missing
* Export logic needs to be updated to match UI's fallback behavior

h3. Proposed Solution

# Update Export Service to check for "Vessel Arrival" event first
# If "Vessel Arrival" is missing, fallback to "Unloaded from Vessel" event timestamp
# Apply this logic consistently across all ocean export endpoints
# Ensure no performance degradation (queries should be optimized)

h3. Components Affected

* Ocean Export Service
* Export data mapping/transformation layer
* Any scheduled report generation logic

h3. Data Validation

* Verify no regressions for shipments with "Vessel Arrival" events
* Validate timestamp accuracy for fallback scenarios
* Test export generation performance (ensure no slowdown)

----

h2. Communication & Rollout Plan

h3. Customer Communication

* Frame as bug fix: "Correcting inconsistency where exports didn't match UI logic"
* Release note: "Export reports now consistently populate POD arrival times using vessel unload data when vessel arrival events are unavailable"
* Proactively notify SC Johnson and other customers using ocean exports

h3. Rollout Approach

* Deploy to staging environment first
* Validate with sample exports from affected customers
* Monitor support tickets for any unexpected feedback post-deployment

----

h2. Future Enhancement Vision

h3. Phase 2: "Carrier Data Only vs. All Data" Configuration

This fix addresses an immediate gap, but it highlights a broader product opportunity:

*Concept*: Introduce an export configuration toggle that allows customers to choose between:

# *"Carrier Data Only"* - Export only raw carrier events without FourKites intelligence layer
# *"All Data (with FourKites Intelligence)"* - Export includes FourKites inferred/derived milestones

*Benefits*:

* ✅ Provides transparency for customers who want to distinguish carrier-provided vs. FourKites-inferred data
* ✅ Addresses multiple scenarios beyond just vessel arrival (inferred pickup/delivery, estimated timestamps, AI/ML-enhanced data)
* ✅ Reduces future config proliferation - one toggle handles many cases
* ✅ Positions FourKites intelligence as a valuable feature customers can control

*Applicable Use Cases*:

* Vessel arrival fallback (current case)
* Inferred pickup/delivery milestones
* Estimated timestamps where actuals are missing
* Any future AI-enhanced data points

*Implementation Considerations*:

* Add export-level configuration setting (not per-field)
* Consider whether this applies to all export templates or is selectable per template
* Document all milestones/fields that include FourKites intelligence
* Ensure clear customer communication about the difference between modes

*Timeline*: Target for Q2 2025 as a strategic product capability

----

h2. Definition of Done

* Code implemented according to specifications
* Unit tests written and passing for fallback logic scenarios
* Integration tests passing for all export types
* Documentation updated (export field definitions, API specs)
* Feature validated in staging environment with sample customer data
* QA verification completed for all acceptance criteria
* Product Manager approval obtained
* Release notes prepared for customer communication
* Support team informed of the change

----

h2. Dependencies

* *Linked Work Item*: MM-13137 (Query ticket - customer reported issue)
** Use "is caused by" link from this story to the query ticket
** Status: Resolved (pending this implementation)

----

h2. Additional Context

h3. RCA Summary (from MM-13137)

* Root cause: Export logic only checks for "Vessel Arrival" event code
* UI successfully derives POD ATA from "Unloaded from Vessel" when VA is missing
* Export service is not configured to apply the same fallback/mapping logic

h3. Customer Operational Context

* SC Johnson team performs bulk reviews using exported reports
* They rely on blank fields to indicate missing data/events
* Current blank fields mislead them to think shipments haven't arrived when they actually have
* This creates unnecessary manual validation work and potential KPI calculation errors

h3. Data Validation Results

* Sample loads analyzed: CO20251018, CO20251019
* Confirmed UI shows POD ATA populated
* Confirmed exports show {{ARRIVED_AT_PORT_OF_DISCHARGE}} as blank
* Verified "Unloaded from Vessel" event exists in backend data

----

*Story Points*: _To be estimated by engineering team_  
*Sprint*: _To be assigned during sprint planning_  
*Priority*: P2 (Customer escalation, operational impact)

issues.summary: Incorrect VA/VD events
issues.description:
Hi Team,

*Shipper:* Louis Dreyfus Company (LDC)
*Example Load:* ONEYTAOFL2320900

*Important Context*
Please note that LDC’s pilot phase with FourKites is nearing completion. As part of this, they will be closely reviewing service performance before making a final subscription decision. The issue outlined below has raised concerns on data reliability.Issue Summary
For the above shipment (and several others), *Vessel Departure (VD)* was marked via an *inferred event* _before_ the vessel was actually loaded.

* The *inferred VD* was marked on *12/02*
* The *actual ERPA update* with VD was received later on *12/04*, after vessel loading
* As a result, the customer sees VD occurring before the load event, which appears unrealistic and confusing

Additionally:

* The inferred *Vessel Arrival (VA)* and *Vessel Departure (VD)* show a gap of only ~2 hours at port
* LDC has questioned how a vessel can arrive and depart within such a short window, especially before loading is completed
* This behavior has been observed across multiple shipments

One consistent pattern across the affected shipments:

* All loads were *created on 12/23*
* However, the *actual sailing dates were on or before 12/02*

This suggests that the system may be inferring VA/VD events retrospectively for historical sailings, possibly due to *late load creation (LLC)*. We need confirmation on whether this is the expected behavior and if LLC is the root cause.Customer Impact

* Data appears unrealistic and inconsistent with actual vessel operations
* Loss of confidence in inferred events and milestone accuracy
* Risk to pilot success and final subscription decision

Ask / Next Steps

# Can you confirm whether *late load creation (LLC)* is causing these inferred VA/VD events to be backfilled incorrectly?
# Is there a way to *suppress or adjust inferred VA/VD* when the sailing has already occurred before load creation?
# What is the recommended *long-term fix* to prevent inferred VD being marked before actual vessel loading?
# Guidance on *customer-facing explanation* would be helpful before we respond to LDC.

Affected Shipments
*Evergreen*

* 159500040475
* 159500036762
* 159500048417

issues.description:

*Carrier:* oceancarrier

*3PL:* Not Provided

*Impacted Feature:* All Milestone Updates

*Environment:* Staging

*Load Number:* *MM_11493_Test_Load_3*

*Tracking ID:* 22615262

 

*Issue Description / Query:*

*Issue Summary:* Reference updates (Booking Number/BOL) from ELC loads are overwriting existing values instead of creating new tracking data entries, preventing historical reference tracking.

*Expected Behavior:* When a Booking Number or Bill of Lading is updated on an ELC-created load, the system should capture tracking data at different timestamps, creating separate entries to maintain a historical record of reference changes.

*Actual Behavior:* The same reference field is being updated repeatedly on the same line/entry. This overwrites previous values and eliminates the ability to track reference change history.

*Impact:* Loss of historical tracking data for reference updates, preventing visibility into when and how Booking Numbers and BOLs were modified over the load's lifecycle.
